12
13ThreadIsolation::TrustedData ThreadIsolation::trusted_data_;
14
15#if V8_HAS_PKU_JIT_WRITE_PROTECT
16
17// static
18int RwxMemoryWriteScope::memory_protection_key() {
19 return ThreadIsolation::pkey();
20}
21
22bool RwxMemoryWriteScope::IsPKUWritable() {
23 DCHECK(ThreadIsolation::initialized());
24 return base::MemoryProtectionKey::GetKeyPermission(ThreadIsolation::pkey()) ==
25 base::MemoryProtectionKey::kNoRestrictions;
26}
27
28void RwxMemoryWriteScope::SetDefaultPermissionsForSignalHandler() {
29 DCHECK(ThreadIsolation::initialized());
30 if (!RwxMemoryWriteScope::IsSupported()) return;
31 base::MemoryProtectionKey::SetPermissionsForKey(
32 ThreadIsolation::pkey(), base::MemoryProtectionKey::kDisableWrite);
33}
34
35#endif // V8_HAS_PKU_JIT_WRITE_PROTECT
36
37RwxMemoryWriteScopeForTesting::RwxMemoryWriteScopeForTesting()
38 : RwxMemoryWriteScope("For Testing") {}
39
40RwxMemoryWriteScopeForTesting::~RwxMemoryWriteScopeForTesting() {}
41
42// static
43bool ThreadIsolation::Enabled() {
44#if V8_HEAP_USE_PKU_JIT_WRITE_PROTECT
45 return allocator() != nullptr;
46#else
47 return false;
48#endif
49}
50
51// static
52template <typename T, typename... Args>
53void ThreadIsolation::ConstructNew(T** ptr, Args&&... args) {
54 if (Enabled()) {
55 *ptr = reinterpret_cast<T*>(trusted_data_.allocator->Allocate(sizeof(T)));
56 if (!*ptr) return;
57 new (*ptr) T(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
58 } else {
59 *ptr = new T(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
60 }
61}
62
63// static
64template <typename T>
65void ThreadIsolation::Delete(T* ptr) {
66 if (Enabled()) {
67 ptr->~T();
68 trusted_data_.allocator->Free(ptr);
69 } else {
70 delete ptr;
71 }
72}
73
74// static
75void ThreadIsolation::Initialize(
76 ThreadIsolatedAllocator* thread_isolated_allocator) {
77#if DEBUG
78 trusted_data_.initialized = true;
79#endif
80
81 bool enable = thread_isolated_allocator != nullptr && !v8_flags.jitless;
82
83#ifdef THREAD_SANITIZER
84 // TODO(sroettger): with TSAN enabled, we get crashes because
85 // SetDefaultPermissionsForSignalHandler gets called while a
86 // RwxMemoryWriteScope is active. It seems that tsan's ProcessPendingSignals
87 // doesn't restore the pkru value after executing the signal handler.
88 enable = false;
89#endif
90
91#if V8_HAS_PKU_JIT_WRITE_PROTECT
92 if (enable &&
93 !base::MemoryProtectionKey::InitializeMemoryProtectionKeySupport()) {
94 enable = false;
95 }
96#endif
97
98 if (enable) {
99 trusted_data_.allocator = thread_isolated_allocator;
100#if V8_HAS_PKU_JIT_WRITE_PROTECT
101 trusted_data_.pkey = trusted_data_.allocator->Pkey();
102#endif
103 }
104
105 {
106 // We need to allocate the memory for jit page tracking even if we don't
107 // enable the ThreadIsolation protections.
108 CFIMetadataWriteScope write_scope("Initialize thread isolation.");
109 ConstructNew(&trusted_data_.jit_pages_mutex_);
110 ConstructNew(&trusted_data_.jit_pages_);
111 }
112
113 if (!enable) {
114 return;
115 }
116
117#if V8_HAS_PKU_JIT_WRITE_PROTECT
118 // Check that our compile time assumed page size that we use for padding was
119 // large enough.
120 CHECK_GE(THREAD_ISOLATION_ALIGN_SZ,
121 GetPlatformPageAllocator()->CommitPageSize());
122
123 // TODO(sroettger): make this immutable once there's OS support.
124 base::MemoryProtectionKey::SetPermissionsAndKey(
125 {reinterpret_cast<Address>(&trusted_data_), sizeof(trusted_data_)},
126 v8::PageAllocator::Permission::kRead,
127 base::MemoryProtectionKey::kDefaultProtectionKey);
128#endif
129}
130
131// static
132ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference ThreadIsolation::LookupJitPageLocked(
133 Address addr, size_t size) {
134 trusted_data_.jit_pages_mutex_->AssertHeld();
135 base::Optional<JitPageReference> jit_page =
136 TryLookupJitPageLocked(addr, size);
137 CHECK(jit_page.has_value());
138 return std::move(jit_page.value());
139}
140
141// static
142ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference ThreadIsolation::LookupJitPage(Address addr,
143 size_t size) {
144 base::MutexGuard guard(trusted_data_.jit_pages_mutex_);
145 return LookupJitPageLocked(addr, size);
146}
147
148// static
149WritableJitPage ThreadIsolation::LookupWritableJitPage(Address addr,
150 size_t size) {
151 return WritableJitPage(addr, size);
152}
153
154// static
155base::Optional<ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference>
156ThreadIsolation::TryLookupJitPage(Address addr, size_t size) {
157 base::MutexGuard guard(trusted_data_.jit_pages_mutex_);
158 return TryLookupJitPageLocked(addr, size);
159}
160
161// static
162base::Optional<ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference>
163ThreadIsolation::TryLookupJitPageLocked(Address addr, size_t size) {
164 trusted_data_.jit_pages_mutex_->AssertHeld();
165
166 Address end = addr + size;
167 CHECK_GT(end, addr);
168
169 // upper_bound gives us an iterator to the position after address.
170 auto it = trusted_data_.jit_pages_->upper_bound(addr);
171
172 // The previous page should be the one we're looking for.
173 if (it == trusted_data_.jit_pages_->begin()) {
174 return {};
175 }
176
177 it--;
178
179 JitPageReference jit_page(it->second, it->first);
180
181 // If the address is not in the range of the jit page, return.
182 if (jit_page.End() <= addr) {
183 return {};
184 }
185
186 if (jit_page.End() >= end) {
187 return jit_page;
188 }
189
190 // It's possible that the allocation spans multiple pages, merge them.
191 auto to_delete_start = ++it;
192 for (; jit_page.End() < end && it != trusted_data_.jit_pages_->end(); it++) {
193 {
194 JitPageReference next_page(it->second, it->first);
195 CHECK_EQ(next_page.Address(), jit_page.End());
196 jit_page.Merge(next_page);
197 }
198 Delete(it->second);
199 }
200
201 trusted_data_.jit_pages_->erase(to_delete_start, it);
202
203 if (jit_page.End() < end) {
204 return {};
205 }
206
207 return jit_page;
208}
209
210namespace {
211
212size_t GetSize(ThreadIsolation::JitPage* jit_page) {
213 return ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference(jit_page, 0).Size();
214}
215
216size_t GetSize(ThreadIsolation::JitAllocation allocation) {
217 return allocation.Size();
218}
219
220template <class T>
221void CheckForRegionOverlap(const T& map, Address addr, size_t size) {
222 // The data is untrusted from the pov of CFI, so we check that there's no
223 // overlaps with existing regions etc.
224 CHECK_GE(addr + size, addr);
225
226 // Find an entry in the map with key > addr
227 auto it = map.upper_bound(addr);
228 bool is_begin = it == map.begin();
229 bool is_end = it == map.end();
230
231 // Check for overlap with the next entry
232 if (!is_end) {
233 Address next_addr = it->first;
234 Address offset = next_addr - addr;
235 CHECK_LE(size, offset);
236 }
237
238 // Check the previous entry for overlap
239 if (!is_begin) {
240 it--;
241 Address prev_addr = it->first;
242 const typename T::value_type::second_type& prev_entry = it->second;
243 Address offset = addr - prev_addr;
244 CHECK_LE(GetSize(prev_entry), offset);
245 }
246}
247
248template <typename Iterator>
249bool AllocationIsBehindRange(Address range_start, Address range_size,
250 const Iterator& it) {
251 Address range_end = range_start + range_size;
252 Address allocation_start = it->first;
253 Address allocation_size = it->second.Size();
254 Address allocation_end = allocation_start + allocation_size;
255
256 if (allocation_start >= range_end) return true;
257
258 CHECK_LE(allocation_end, range_end);
259 return false;
260}
261
262} // namespace
263
264ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference::JitPageReference(class JitPage* jit_page,
265 base::Address address)
266 : page_lock_(&jit_page->mutex_), jit_page_(jit_page), address_(address) {}
267
268ThreadIsolation::JitPage::~JitPage() {
269 // TODO(sroettger): check that the page is not in use (scan shadow stacks).
270}
271
272size_t ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference::Size() const {
273 return jit_page_->size_;
274}
275
276void ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference::Shrink(class JitPage* tail) {
277 jit_page_->size_ -= tail->size_;
278 // Move all allocations that are out of bounds.
279 auto it = jit_page_->allocations_.lower_bound(End());
280 tail->allocations_.insert(it, jit_page_->allocations_.end());
281 jit_page_->allocations_.erase(it, jit_page_->allocations_.end());
282}
283
284void ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference::Expand(size_t offset) {
285 jit_page_->size_ += offset;
286}
287
288void ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference::Merge(JitPageReference& next) {
289 DCHECK_EQ(End(), next.Address());
290 jit_page_->size_ += next.jit_page_->size_;
291 next.jit_page_->size_ = 0;
292 jit_page_->allocations_.merge(next.jit_page_->allocations_);
293 DCHECK(next.jit_page_->allocations_.empty());
294}
295
296ThreadIsolation::JitAllocation&
297ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference::RegisterAllocation(base::Address addr,
298 size_t size,
299 JitAllocationType type) {
300 // The data is untrusted from the pov of CFI, so the checks are security
301 // sensitive.
302 CHECK_GE(addr, address_);
303 base::Address offset = addr - address_;
304 base::Address end_offset = offset + size;
305 CHECK_GT(end_offset, offset);
306 CHECK_GT(jit_page_->size_, offset);
307 CHECK_GE(jit_page_->size_, end_offset);
308
309 CheckForRegionOverlap(jit_page_->allocations_, addr, size);
310 return jit_page_->allocations_.emplace(addr, JitAllocation(size, type))
311 .first->second;
312}
313
314ThreadIsolation::JitAllocation&
315ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference::LookupAllocation(base::Address addr,
316 size_t size,
317 JitAllocationType type) {
318 auto it = jit_page_->allocations_.find(addr);
319 CHECK_NE(it, jit_page_->allocations_.end());
320 CHECK_EQ(it->second.Size(), size);
321 CHECK_EQ(it->second.Type(), type);
322 return it->second;
323}
324
325void ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference::UnregisterAllocation(
326 base::Address addr) {
327 // TODO(sroettger): check that the memory is not in use (scan shadow stacks).
328 CHECK_EQ(jit_page_->allocations_.erase(addr), 1);
329}
330
331void ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference::UnregisterRange(base::Address start,
332 size_t size) {
333 auto begin = jit_page_->allocations_.lower_bound(start);
334 auto end = begin;
335 while (end != jit_page_->allocations_.end() &&
336 !AllocationIsBehindRange(start, size, end)) {
337 end++;
338 }
339
340 // TODO(sroettger): check that the memory is not in use (scan shadow stacks).
341 jit_page_->allocations_.erase(begin, end);
342}
343
344void ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference::UnregisterAllocationsExcept(
345 base::Address start, size_t size, const std::vector<base::Address>& keep) {
346 // TODO(sroettger): check that the page is not in use (scan shadow stacks).
347 JitPage::AllocationMap keep_allocations;
348
349 auto keep_before = jit_page_->allocations_.lower_bound(start);
350 auto keep_after = jit_page_->allocations_.lower_bound(start + size);
351
352 // keep all allocations before the start address.
353 if (keep_before != jit_page_->allocations_.begin()) {
354 keep_before--;
355 keep_allocations.insert(jit_page_->allocations_.begin(), keep_before);
356 }
357
358 // from the start address, keep only allocations passed in the vector
359 auto keep_iterator = keep.begin();
360 for (auto it = keep_before; it != keep_after; it++) {
361 if (keep_iterator == keep.end()) break;
362 if (it->first == *keep_iterator) {
363 keep_allocations.emplace_hint(keep_allocations.end(), it->first,
364 it->second);
365 keep_iterator++;
366 }
367 }
368 CHECK_EQ(keep_iterator, keep.end());
369
370 // keep all allocations after the region
371 keep_allocations.insert(keep_after, jit_page_->allocations_.end());
372
373 jit_page_->allocations_.swap(keep_allocations);
374}
375
376base::Address ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference::StartOfAllocationAt(
377 base::Address inner_pointer) {
378 return AllocationContaining(inner_pointer).first;
379}
380
381std::pair<base::Address, ThreadIsolation::JitAllocation&>
382ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference::AllocationContaining(
383 base::Address inner_pointer) {
384 auto it = jit_page_->allocations_.upper_bound(inner_pointer);
385 CHECK_NE(it, jit_page_->allocations_.begin());
386 it--;
387 size_t offset = inner_pointer - it->first;
388 CHECK_GT(it->second.Size(), offset);
389 return {it->first, it->second};
390}
391
392// static
393void ThreadIsolation::RegisterJitPage(Address address, size_t size) {
394 CFIMetadataWriteScope write_scope("Adding new executable memory.");
395
396 base::MutexGuard guard(trusted_data_.jit_pages_mutex_);
397 CheckForRegionOverlap(*trusted_data_.jit_pages_, address, size);
398 JitPage* jit_page;
399 ConstructNew(&jit_page, size);
400 trusted_data_.jit_pages_->emplace(address, jit_page);
401}
402
403void ThreadIsolation::UnregisterJitPage(Address address, size_t size) {
404 // TODO(sroettger): merge the write scopes higher up.
405 CFIMetadataWriteScope write_scope("Removing executable memory.");
406
407 JitPage* to_delete;
408 {
409 base::MutexGuard guard(trusted_data_.jit_pages_mutex_);
410 JitPageReference jit_page = LookupJitPageLocked(address, size);
411
412 // We're merging jit pages together, so potentially split them back up
413 // if we're only freeing a subrange.
414
415 Address to_free_end = address + size;
416 Address jit_page_end = jit_page.Address() + jit_page.Size();
417
418 if (to_free_end < jit_page_end) {
419 // There's a tail after the page that we release. Shrink the page and
420 // add the tail to the map.
421 size_t tail_size = jit_page_end - to_free_end;
422 JitPage* tail;
423 ConstructNew(&tail, tail_size);
424 jit_page.Shrink(tail);
425 trusted_data_.jit_pages_->emplace(to_free_end, tail);
426 }
427
428 DCHECK_EQ(to_free_end, jit_page.Address() + jit_page.Size());
429
430 if (address == jit_page.Address()) {
431 // We remove the start of the region, just remove it from the map.
432 to_delete = jit_page.JitPage();
433 trusted_data_.jit_pages_->erase(address);
434 } else {
435 // Otherwise, we need to shrink the region.
436 DCHECK_GT(address, jit_page.Address());
437 JitPage* tail;
438 ConstructNew(&tail, size);
439 jit_page.Shrink(tail);
440 to_delete = tail;
441 }
442 }
443 Delete(to_delete);
444}
445
446// static
447bool ThreadIsolation::MakeExecutable(Address address, size_t size) {
448 DCHECK(Enabled());
449
450 // TODO(sroettger): ensure that this can only happen at prcoess startup.
451
452#if V8_HAS_PKU_JIT_WRITE_PROTECT
453 return base::MemoryProtectionKey::SetPermissionsAndKey(
454 {address, size}, PageAllocator::Permission::kReadWriteExecute, pkey());
455#else // V8_HAS_PKU_JIT_WRITE_PROTECT
456 UNREACHABLE();
457#endif // V8_HAS_PKU_JIT_WRITE_PROTECT
458}

471 JitAllocationType::kInstructionStream);

477 return WritableJitAllocation(
478 addr, size, type, WritableJitAllocation::JitAllocationSource::kLookup);
479}

481// static
482WritableJumpTablePair ThreadIsolation::LookupJumpTableAllocations(
483 Address jump_table_address, size_t jump_table_size,
484 Address far_jump_table_address, size_t far_jump_table_size) {
485 return WritableJumpTablePair(jump_table_address, jump_table_size,
486 far_jump_table_address, far_jump_table_size);
487}
488
489// static
490void ThreadIsolation::RegisterJitAllocations(Address start,
491 const std::vector<size_t>& sizes,
492 JitAllocationType type) {
493 CFIMetadataWriteScope write_scope("Register bulk allocations.");
494
495 size_t total_size = 0;
496 for (auto size : sizes) {
497 total_size += size;
498 }
499
500 constexpr size_t kSplitThreshold = 0x40000;
501 JitPageReference page_ref = total_size >= kSplitThreshold
502 ? SplitJitPage(start, total_size)
503 : LookupJitPage(start, total_size);
504
505 for (auto size : sizes) {
506 page_ref.RegisterAllocation(start, size, type);
507 start += size;
508 }
509}
510
511void ThreadIsolation::RegisterJitAllocationForTesting(Address obj,
512 size_t size) {
513 RegisterJitAllocation(obj, size, JitAllocationType::kInstructionStream);
514}
515
516// static
517void ThreadIsolation::UnregisterJitAllocationForTesting(Address addr,
518 size_t size) {
519 LookupJitPage(addr, size).UnregisterAllocation(addr);
520}
521
522// static
523void ThreadIsolation::UnregisterWasmAllocation(Address addr, size_t size) {
524 CFIMetadataWriteScope write_scope("UnregisterWasmAllocation");
525 LookupJitPage(addr, size).UnregisterAllocation(addr);
526}
527
528ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference ThreadIsolation::SplitJitPage(Address addr,
529 size_t size) {
530 base::MutexGuard guard(trusted_data_.jit_pages_mutex_);
531 return SplitJitPageLocked(addr, size);
532}
533
534ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference ThreadIsolation::SplitJitPageLocked(
535 Address addr, size_t size) {
536 trusted_data_.jit_pages_mutex_->AssertHeld();
537
538 JitPageReference jit_page = LookupJitPageLocked(addr, size);
539
540 // Split the JitPage into upto three pages.
541 size_t head_size = addr - jit_page.Address();
542 size_t tail_size = jit_page.Size() - size - head_size;
543 if (tail_size > 0) {
544 JitPage* tail;
545 ConstructNew(&tail, tail_size);
546 jit_page.Shrink(tail);
547 trusted_data_.jit_pages_->emplace(addr + size, tail);
548 }
549 if (head_size > 0) {
550 JitPage* mid;
551 ConstructNew(&mid, size);
552 jit_page.Shrink(mid);
553 trusted_data_.jit_pages_->emplace(addr, mid);
554 return JitPageReference(mid, addr);
555 }
556
557 return jit_page;
558}
559
560std::pair<ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference, ThreadIsolation::JitPageReference>
561ThreadIsolation::SplitJitPages(Address addr1, size_t size1, Address addr2,
562 size_t size2) {
563 if (addr1 > addr2) {
564 auto reversed_pair = SplitJitPages(addr2, size2, addr1, size1);
565 return {std::move(reversed_pair.second), std::move(reversed_pair.first)};
566 }
567 // Make sure there's no overlap. SplitJitPageLocked will do additional checks
568 // that the sizes don't overflow.
569 CHECK_LE(addr1 + size1, addr2);
570
571 base::MutexGuard guard(trusted_data_.jit_pages_mutex_);
572 return {SplitJitPageLocked(addr1, size1), SplitJitPageLocked(addr2, size2)};
573}
574
575// static
576base::Optional<Address> ThreadIsolation::StartOfJitAllocationAt(
577 Address inner_pointer) {
578 CFIMetadataWriteScope write_scope("StartOfJitAllocationAt");
579 base::Optional<JitPageReference> page = TryLookupJitPage(inner_pointer, 1);
580 if (!page) {
581 return {};
582 }
583 return page->StartOfAllocationAt(inner_pointer);
584}

586namespace {
587
588class MutexUnlocker {
589 public:
590 explicit MutexUnlocker(base::Mutex& mutex) : mutex_(mutex) {
591 mutex_.AssertHeld();
592 }
593
594 ~MutexUnlocker() {
595 mutex_.AssertHeld();
596 mutex_.Unlock();
597 }
598
599 private:
600 base::Mutex& mutex_;
601};
602
603} // namespace
604
605// static
606bool ThreadIsolation::CanLookupStartOfJitAllocationAt(Address inner_pointer) {
607 CFIMetadataWriteScope write_scope("CanLookupStartOfJitAllocationAt");
608
609 // Try to lock the pages mutex and the mutex of the page itself to prevent
610 // potential dead locks. The profiler can try to do a lookup from a signal
611 // handler. If that signal handler runs while the thread locked one of these
612 // mutexes, it would result in a dead lock.
613 bool pages_mutex_locked = trusted_data_.jit_pages_mutex_->TryLock();
614 if (!pages_mutex_locked) {
615 return false;
616 }
617 MutexUnlocker pages_mutex_unlocker(*trusted_data_.jit_pages_mutex_);
618
619 // upper_bound gives us an iterator to the position after address.
620 auto it = trusted_data_.jit_pages_->upper_bound(inner_pointer);
621
622 // The previous page should be the one we're looking for.
623 if (it == trusted_data_.jit_pages_->begin()) {
624 return {};
625 }
626 it--;
627
628 JitPage* jit_page = it->second;
629 bool jit_page_locked = jit_page->mutex_.TryLock();
630 if (!jit_page_locked) {
631 return false;
632 }
633 jit_page->mutex_.Unlock();
634
635 return true;
636}
637
638#if DEBUG
639
640// static
641void ThreadIsolation::CheckTrackedMemoryEmpty() {
642 DCHECK(trusted_data_.jit_pages_->empty());
643}
644
645#endif // DEBUG
